Description: Lower body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown, with, above, part of band in added white and, below, added red and white bands; exterior: two brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 27 is written in pencil on the exterior surface. Bands on the cul of chalices appears as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0714) (phase 2)
